instruments¶

class control.instruments.Agilent33220A(address, connection_type, connection_manager=None)¶

The Agilent33220A class is used to control a Agilent 33220A function generator via GPIB.

class control.instruments.Agilent34401A(address, connection_type, connection_manager=None)¶

The Agilent34401A class is used to control a Agilent 34401A series multimeter via GPIB.

class control.instruments.AgilentE3631A(address, connection_type, connection_manager=None)¶

The AgilentE3631A class is used to control a Agilent E3631A DC power source via GPIB.

class control.instruments.AgilentE3633A(address, connection_type, connection_manager=None)¶

The AgilentE3633A class is used to control a Agilent E3633A DC power source via GPIB.

class control.instruments.HP8350B(address, connection_type, connection_manager=None)¶

The HP8350B class is used to control an HP8350B Sweep Oscillator via GPIB (now owned by Keysight).

class control.instruments.PasternackPE11S390(address, connection_type, connection_manager=None)¶

The PasternackPE11S390 class is used to control a Pasternack PE11S390 series frequency synthesizers via USB.

class control.instruments.SR830(address, connection_type, connection_manager=None)¶

The SR830 class is used to control a Stanford Research Systems SR830 Lock-In Amplifier via GPIB.

get_channel1_display()¶

Returns a tuple of the channel 1 display and ratio, see the DISPLAY_CHANNEL1 and DISPLAY_CHANNEL1_RATIO constants.

get_channel1_scanned_data(start_bin=0, bins_to_return=0)¶

Returns a list of data stored in the channel1 data buffer. This data is whatever has been selected by the set_channel1_output() function (see also the set_channel1_display() function).

Parameters:
  • start_bin – The bin in the data buffer to start returning.
  • bins_to_return – The number of bins to return. If start_bin + bins_to_return is greater than the total

number of bins than an error occurs.

get_channel2_display()¶

Returns a tuple of the channel 2 display and ratio, see the DISPLAY_CHANNEL2 and DISPLAY_CHANNEL2_RATIO constants.

get_channel2_scanned_data(start_bin=0, bins_to_return=0)¶

Returns a list of data stored in the channel2 data buffer. This data is whatever has been selected by the set_channel2_output() function (see also the set_channel2_display() function).

Parameters:
  • start_bin – The bin in the data buffer to start returning.
  • bins_to_return – The number of bins to return. If start_bin + bins_to_return is greater than the total

number of bins than an error occurs.

get_storage_time()¶

Returns the amount of time in seconds that the instrument can store at the current sample rate.

snap_values(values)¶

Measures most of values specified in values at a single instant in time. Measurements are returned in a dictionary where the keys are the strings in the values list parameter. Please see the SR830 manual p 5-15 for more. Values (excluding THETA) are returned in volts.

Parameters:values – A list containing up to 6 values to snap. The list can contain strings ‘X’, ‘Y’, ‘R’, ‘THETA’,

‘AUX1’, ‘AUX2’, ‘AUX3’, ‘AUX4’, ‘REF_FREQ’ (for the reference frequency), ‘CH1’, and ‘CH2’ (for channels 1 and 2, respectively). If the list is longer than 6 values, only the first 6 values will be snapped.
